title.narrative: 004 URBAN Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: By 2025, Children and families in urban areas have equitable access to basic Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services including in humanitarian situations. , which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2025 children and their families in rural and urban areas use safe, affordable and sustainable water, sanitation and practice appropriate hygiene

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, Children and families in urban areas have equitable access to basic WASH services including in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: Upstream activities are ongoing related to the coordination of Urban WASH sector partners, formulation of a national regulatory framework of urban utilities and integration of refugees in the ONE WASH National Programme implementation. While UNICEF continues to invest in sustainable systems in urban / refugee areas, 655,947 people were reached with water services, 403,376peoplewith safely managed sanitation services and 766,179with hygiene promotion. Detailed designs have been completed for six complex towns and refugee WASH systems and works are ongoing in Itang and Gure-Shembola. Diagnostic assessment is ongoing in 10 towns for system strengthening. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/01/2022
